title: Fallout Season 2 Episode Release Date Schedule
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Fallout Season 2 premieres on...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Fallout Season 2 premieres on December 17, and in a big change from Season 1, episodes will be released weekly instead of all at once. Prime Video has now published the full release schedule for Fallout Season 2, so you can plan and prepare for all eight episodes.Episodes will be released weekly on Wednesdays at midnight PT, and the sophomore season will run through February 4, 2026. Fallout Season 1 also had eight episodes.Fallout Season 2 scheduleEpisode 1 - December 17 at 12 AM PT / 3 AM ETEpisode 2- December 24 at 12 AM PT / 3 AM ETEpisode 3 - December 31 at 12 AM PT / 3 AM ETEpisode 4 - January 7 at 12 AM PT / 3 AM ETEpisode 5 - January 14 at 12 AM PT / 3 AM ETEpisode 6 - January 21 at 12 AM PT / 3 AM ETEpisode 7 - January 28 at 12 AM PT / 3 AM ETEpisode 8 - February 4 at 12 AM PT / 3 AM ET          With Season 1, some people enjoyed having all episodes release at the same time so they could binge the series. Others said they wished it was released weekly to give them time to digest.Fallout airs on Prime Video, but if you have a Samsung TV and don't mind watching ads, you can watch the entirety of Season 1 for free right now.Fallout Season 2 brings on new cast members, including Macaulay Culkin and Kumail Nanjiani, while the story heads to New Vegas.As for the game series, Fallout 76 just got its Burning Springs update that added The Ghoul, the character from the TV series played by Walton Goggins. Additionally, Bethesda is working on Fallout 5, but it's still very early days.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Skyblivion Is Delayed To 2026, But It Already Looks Very Good
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          The dream of Skyblivion goes...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                The dream of Skyblivion goes back over a decade as a team of fans came together to use The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim's engine to fully recreate and re-imagine Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion as a modern RPG. At the beginning of 2023, the team set a 2025 premiere for Skyblivion. However, that's no longer the plan and Skyblivion has been pushed to next year. The good news is that the latest dev video shows off how much has been finished and what remains to be done.          Skyblivion lead Rebelzize narrates the video as he offers a guide to where things stand. According to Rebelzize, most of the work has already been done and over 70 volunteer contributors are still hard at work trying to get the ambitious mod across the finish line.When this project was started, The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion was far out of date. Earlier this year, Bethesda released Oblivion Remastered, which could have taken the wind out of this team's project. Instead, Rebelzize and others praised the remaster as a "win-win" for the community. In recognition for their work, Bethesda gave copies of Oblivion Remastered to the entire Skyblivion mod team.However, it hasn't been entirely harmonious for team Skyblivion. Earlier this year, a former member of the team spoke out against efforts to rush the mod out before it's ready. As impressive as Skyblivion is, no one is getting paid for it, and the ex-team member is against the crunch-time mindset that was making things more difficult.For now, it looks like Skyblivion is worth the wait. Although Bethesda does offer some support for mods on consoles, it will only be available on PC. Skyblivion will also require players to own both Elder Scrolls 5 and Elder Scrolls 4 in order to work.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: Call Of Duty Mobile Season 11 Adds A Cool Crossover You Won't Find In Black Ops 7
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          Call of Duty Mobile is...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                Call of Duty Mobile is celebrating the game's sixth anniversary with plenty of new content. While Black Ops 7 is sticking to thematically appropriate operator skins, Season 11 of Call of Duty Mobile includes a major crossover with Street Fighter, which allows players to transform into the popular fighting characters and use their iconic fighting moves. This new season also adds a DMZ extraction mode, new loadout items to unlock, and special events.Season 11 start date detailsSeason 11 starts on December 11 at 12 PM PT / 3 PM ET. This new season includes a brand-new battle pass with both free and premium items.Battle pass detailsThe main highlights of the free battle-pass tiers are the SO-14 marksman rifle and Wheelson-HS scorestreak. There are also weapon blueprints, skins, and other cosmetics available to unlock for free.For the premium tiers, the battle pass offers the "Mauy Claus" Santa operator skin for Ajax and the "Iron Kata" skin for Sparrowhawk. Holiday-themed weapon blueprints are included for the Krig 6 assault rifle, CBR4 submachine gun, and the season's new SO-14 marksman rifle.          New eventsNew events will allow players to earn Street Fighter-themed rewards and other cosmetics from Secret Caches. Each Secret Cache offers a random reward, and they are available to earn through many different events throughout the season, with four caches available to claim daily through login rewards and various events.Season 11 also includes sixth anniversary-themed rewards across two separate anniversary events. These rewards include items, such as weapon blueprints, calling cards, weapon charms, and more.Additionally, holiday events will also arrive later in the season for players to earn festive cosmetics.Street Fighter LTMsCall of Duty Mobile's Street Fighter collabWhile Activision has decided to shy away from wacky skins for Black Ops 7, the publisher continues to introduce major IP crossovers into Call of Duty Mobile. Season 11 is themed around Street Fighter, and this brings new challenges and limited-time game modes inspired by the characters of the iconic fighting game.For multiplayer, Shoryu and Hadoken is a limited-time mode available across a select map pool. Scorestreaks are disabled in this mode, and operators enter the match equipped with only the Prizefighter gloves melee weapon and increased jump height, which is meant to reflect the martial style of Street Fighter.Players melee and build up a rage meter until they earn enough to transform into either Hidora Kai for Ryu or Shigenori for Akuma. Ryu's move set offers his classic Hadoken projectile ability and his powerful wave motion fist attack, Shinku Hadoken. Akuma's combat style uses the Shoryuken rising uppercut and the Shun Goku Satsu attack. The first player to land enough eliminations is the winner.Battle royale also has a limited-time Street Fighter mode. This lets players find holograms of four different Street Fighter characters on the mode's Isolated map. Interacting with the holograms for Ryu, Akuma, Chun-Li, and Cammy will let the player acquire their unique abilities and activate special attacks to use during the match.DMZ Recon modeDMZ Recon Serpent Island mapCall of Duty Mobile adds a new extraction mode inspired by Modern Warfare 2's DMZ called DMZ Recon. This introduces a brand-new map called Serpent Island, which is a large-scale map composed of multiple zones, including points of interest inspired by fan-favorite Call of Duty maps. Players will need to drop in, loot up, and extract to keep their gear.Building 21 from MW2 DMZ also returns. This is an entirely indoor map spread out over three floors, offering a faster pace and more close-quarters action compared to the larger Serpent Island map.Additionally, DMZ Recon features new challenges and over 20 more camos to unlock for Call of Duty mobile.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
